x8021x_h.txt1: IEEE 802.1X is an IEEE standard for port-based Network Admission Control providing secure authentication of wired and wireless network devices. IEEE 802.1X is based on EAP (Extensible Authentication Protocol).
x8021x_h.txt2: To access a network protected by IEEE 802.1X, network devices must authenticate themselves. The authentication is performed by an authentication server, typically a RADIUS server, examples of which are FreeRADIUS and Microsoft Internet Authentication Server.
x8021x_h.txt3: In Axis' implementation, the Axis product and the authentication server authenticate themselves with digitial certificates using EAP-TLS (Extensible Authentication Protocol - Transport Layer Security).

x8021x_h.txt9: CA Certificate - The CA certificate validates the identity of the authentication server. Select the certificate from the list of installed certificates.
x8021x_h.txt10: Client Certificate - The client certificate validates the identity of the Axis product. Select the certificate from the list of installed certificates.
x8021x_h.txt11: EAPOL version - Select the EAPOL version (1 or 2) as used in the network switch.
x8021x_h.txt12: EAP identity - Enter the user identity (maximum 32 characters) associated with the certificate.
x8021x_h.txt13: Enable IEEE 802.1X - Check the box to enable the IEEE 802.1X protocol.
